sub_title: Circular Economy Expert at Ecoras I I help organizations grow towards I Green Chemistry I Circular & Sustainable Plastics I Bio based Products & Applications I Do you have a Circular Challenge? Send me a DM :)
summary:
Does your organization struggle with actually implementing circular processes and solutions? 

Well, that’s what I help with. I work with organizations by guiding them in making the right choices to become circular and future proof.

When clients work with me, they get:
•	up to date knowledge on the latest circular economy developments
•	the network to connect with essential partners
•	a practical, results and pragmatic focused approach 

When it comes to building a future proof organization, I know you are aware of the demand for more circular processes and solutions, from either clients, investors and/or colleagues.

You want to be resilient and innovative as well as profitable, and this requires change. 

But in order to change, you need the right tools and knowledge about 
• Circular business models
• Product Design strategies
• Your Value Chain & Environmental + Economic impact analysis

And this is information you do not have internally.

I understand how difficult, frustrating and time consuming it can be to gain the expertise to make the right choices pointed towards circularity.
 
That’s why I’m proud to say, I’ve personally helped over 50 organizations in the road towards circularity, together with Ecoras.

Your focus is to lead your company towards becoming circular, while staying innovative and profitable.

So, reach out to me so that we can help you.

Stop losing time and resources and start making decisions based on knowledge of the circular market.
Let me guide you towards becoming future proof and circular.

Willemien Veele
www.ecoras.nl 
w.a.veele@ecoras.nl
050 317 5550

About me:
My interests are within the circular economy and biobased economy, life cycle assessment, Value and supply chain analysis, waste and resource management, reuse and recycling, biological solutions and innovations. I am an enthusiastic social team player that works hard to achieve set goals. I contribute to a transition to a more circular and bio based economy by building new value chains and helping businesses and organizations reach their circular ambitions. My passion lies within waste topics, how to prevent it from forming by smart and circular design, process optimization and to see waste as a resource instead of a nuisance. Let's get connected!

organizations.name: GLV Idun (student association of the Groninger Levenswetenschappen vereniging)

projects.title: Finalist in the Statkraft Case Competition at the ISES 2013
projects.description:
Joined the Statkraft Case Competion during the International Student Energy Summit (ISES) 2013 in Trondheim, Norway. 
- Topic: Design a plausible energy scenario for the UK in 2050 with the goal to reduce their CO2 emissions by 80% compared to 1990. The scenario had to be affordable, maintain a security of supply and tackle climate change. 
- My main taks was project management.
Together with my team of 5 we made it to the finals. Unfortunatley we did not win, but it was a great experience.

Realfagslærer hos RUDOLF STEINERSKOLEN I BERGEN

projects.title: Smart Grids project: Are Smart Grids a better option for renewables?
projects.description: Researched the possibility of Smart Grids to reduce the fluctuations within the electricity grid when more renewable energy (wind and solar) is applied to the Dutch electricity grid. This was studied using several models (PowerPlan, SimaPro). Conclusion. Yes, Smart Grids do offer better chances for intermittent energy source from a technical and environmental perspective. From an economical and societal perspective more attention is needed from the Dutch government to be able to implement Smart Grids.

courses.name: Introduction into Energy and Environmental Sciences

profile_positions.description:
We are Ecoras
And we believe that waste does not have to exist. It is high time to use our raw materials differently and more carefully. No longer exhausting the earth, but designing and organizing systems differently. In a practical and applicable way. So that we can achieve a circular economy that contributes to a liveable planet in the foreseeable future. 

What does Ecoras do? 
We use our expertise and competences to work on a liveable planet together with organizations that want to handle raw materials carefully and responsibly. 

Ecoras provides insight into the value chain and overview of the industrial ecosystem. We realize projects that matter and deliver tangible results for organizations and society. We believe this always starts with the raw materials; We strive for increased use of biobased raw materials as well as reused/recycled raw materials. That is raw materials that flow back to another production system (cradle-to-cradle) at the end of their life phase in an environmentally efficient manner. Our expertise lies in the three domains: Green Chemistry, Sustainable Polymers and Biobased Solutions. 

Within Ecoras I am active within the field of Circular Plastics and Life Cycle Assessment (LCA). We use the Life Cycle Assessment approach as a tool for strategy, business and product development. Next to that we are able to provide scope 1, 2 and 3 GHG protocol reports, EPD's and PEF's as well as CO2 footprints and other environmental impact measurements. We work according to ISO 14040 and 14044. 

For more information: 
www.ecoras.nl
w.a.veele@ecoras.nl
050 317 5550
profile_positions.title: Senior Consultant Biobased & Circular Economy

profile_positions.description: Within this role as aanjager or change-maker I have mapped the circular plastics assets and potential of the Northern Netherlands. I have motivated, inspired and guided serveral companies (large and small) to start seizing the opportunities that are within the circular economy. I have organised several multi stakeholder events, building new value chains from which innovative projects have been developed. By seeing the connections, possibilities and potential between stakeholders I have helped the transition of not only organisations, but the region as whole to take the next step to becoming more circular, especially on the topic of Circular Plastics. I have written an Transition Action Agenda and a Proposition for the region on Circular Plastics. This has resulted in the Program called The Clean North which has now been taken up into Greenwise Campus - Circular Plastics as an organisation the further lead this transition. I ofcourse never did this all by myself. By working together with all the different (amzing) people in the region this was made possibe. Together we can and are doing it!
profile_positions.title: Aanjager Circulaire Plastics

profile_positions.description:
Ubuntu is an African term that signifies the "Oneness of Humanity". Loosely translated, it means "I am because we are". Ubuntoo was founded on the philosophy that mankind's greatest challenges cannot be solved by any one person, company or country. Only when we collectively take action on specific problems, can we hope to make a truly significant impact. 

At Ubuntoo, we are creating a global marketplace for environmental and social solutions that connects big corporations and institutions to a groundswell of purpose-driven entrepreneurs, innovators and influencers. We are using cutting edge technology, global networks and effective measurement systems to help scale the most impactful solutions through commercially viable business models. 

Whether you are someone searching for a sustainability solution or looking to scale one, an investor or a potential partner, contact us. We would love to start a dialogue.
profile_positions.title: Value Chain Development

profile_positions.description:
BERNN or Bio Economy Region Northern Netherlands is a collaboration between the applied universities (Stenden, Hanzehogeschool Groningen, Van Hall Larenstein and Noordelijk hogeschool Leeuwarden) and the university of Groningen within the field of Biobased Economy. 

BERNN wants to improve knowledge transfer within and between institutes, especially towards business. This entails sharing facilities, know-how and human resources. New courses will be developed for generating green operators and human capital that matches with the needs from businesses. BERNN is the key to biobased knowledge. 

Check www.bernn.nl for more information.
profile_positions.title: Project Coordinator

profile_positions.description: I have travelled to Russia, Mongolia, China, South Korea, New Zealand, Australia, Singapore and Malaysia. It was an amazing experience which has changed my look on the world. Especially concerning waste and resource management. This is definitely a field of expertise in love to work in.
profile_positions.title: World Traveler

profile_positions.description: I worked on behalf of the BE-Basic project and made an inventory of all the biobased related tertiary and post-graduate education which is available within the Netherlands. The research was the basis of a PhD project that started in September 2014. Supervised by Dr. Janneke Krooneman (RuG).
profile_positions.title: Project assistant BiobRuG

profile_positions.description: On behalf of the Northern Chamber of Commerce I made a quantitative and economic assessment of the biobased economy in the Northern region of the Netherlands. Supervised by Dr. Gjalt de Jong (RuG) and Prof. Dr. Gert-jan Euverink (RuG).
profile_positions.title: Project assistent at the department Global Economics and Management and BiobRuG

profile_positions.description: Organized several information days for prospective students interested in studying Biology and/or Life Science and Technology at the University of Groningen.
profile_positions.title: Assistent information and education team

profile_positions.description: Supervised and teached first year biology and life sciences students during the course Biomedical Reseach.
profile_positions.title: Student assistent Biomedical Research course

profile_positions.description:
Learning thesis: The use of microalgae as method for phosphorus removal from a human derived waste stream. From a lab scale to a household scale cultivation system. 
Supervised by Dr. Han van der Strate (RuG), Dr. Peter Boelen (RuG) and Dr. Ir. Sanderine Nonhebel (RuG). In cooperation with DeSaH, Sneek. 

Combined experimental work with a feasibility study. Follow-up experimental research has been performed based on this research.
profile_positions.title: Learning thesis at Ocean Ecosystems

profile_positions.description: Head of 12 student mentors for Life Science and Biology students. Supervising up to 40 new students, giving them an introduction to the university as well as being a counselor for the students. Organizing mentor group meetings and discussions. Being representative and giving presentations during introduction days. Planning, preparing and chairing the meetings with the mentors next to the work as mentor.
profile_positions.title: Head of Student Mentors

profile_positions.description: Assisted first year biology and life sciences students in the dissection of a rat and a veal hearth.
profile_positions.title: Student assistant Complex organisms course

profile_positions.description:
Graduation thesis: Comparative system analyses of different municipal solid waste separation technologies. Supervisors: Prof. Dr. Henk Moll (RuG),  Ir. Arend Bolt (Van Gansewinkel Groep) and Dr. René Benders (RuG). 

Developed a model which contained extensive energy- and mass balances and the CO2 footprint of different waste treatment technologies within their process chains. The model was used as a tool in future research and for calculating the economic aspects of the different technologies. The report was accepted by the municipality of Rotterdam and The Hague and used within their waste policy.
profile_positions.title: Internship at Van Gansewinkel Group

profile_positions.description: Supervised and assisted both Dutch and English speaking medical students and biology and life science students during the practical work of the course Medical Microbiology.
profile_positions.title: Student assistant at Medical Microbiology course

profile_positions.description: Tour guide for Vinea, the largest travel agency for children between the ages of 6 til 19. Went to Schotland in the summer of 2010 to walk the West-Highland way (192 km) with kids from 15-19.
profile_positions.title: Tour guide
